issue.title: [C++] Always use statically-linked Boost with private namespace
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2703](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2703). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We have recently added tooling to ship Python wheels with a bundled, private Boost (using the bcp tool). We might consider statically-linking a private Boost exclusively in libarrow (i.e. built via our thirdparty toolchain) to avoid any conflicts with other libraries that may use a different version of Boost

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2703?focusedCommentId=16761475) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
It would be useful to provide CMake options to do this, but not be the default

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2703?focusedCommentId=16846159) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Removing this from any milestone as it bears more discussion and is not an urgency
